title: 1436-F
statement: F. Sum Over Subsetstime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a multiset $$$S$$$. Over all pairs of subsets $$$A$$$ and $$$B$$$, such that:$$$B \\subset A$$$;$$$|B| = |A| - 1$$$;greatest common divisor of all elements in $$$A$$$ is equal to one;find the sum of $$$\\sum_{x \\in A}{x} \\cdot \\sum_{x \\in B}{x}$$$, modulo $$$998\\,244\\,353$$$.InputThe first line contains one integer $$$m$$$ ($$$1 \\le m \\le 10^5$$$): the number of different values in the multiset $$$S$$$.Each of the next $$$m$$$ lines contains two integers $$$a_i$$$, $$$freq_i$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 10^5, 1 \\le freq_i \\le 10^9$$$). Element $$$a_i$$$ appears in the multiset $$$S$$$ $$$freq_i$$$ times. All $$$a_i$$$ are different.OutputPrint the required sum, modulo $$$998\\,244\\,353$$$.ExamplesInput2 1 1 2 1Output9Input4 1 1 2 1 3 1 6 1Output1207Input1 1 5Output560NoteA multiset is a set where elements are allowed to coincide. $$$|X|$$$ is the cardinality of a set $$$X$$$, the number of elements in it.$$$A \\subset B$$$: Set $$$A$$$ is a subset of a set $$$B$$$.In the first example $$$B=\\{1\\}, A=\\{1,2\\}$$$ and $$$B=\\{2\\}, A=\\{1, 2\\}$$$ have a product equal to $$$1\\cdot3 + 2\\cdot3=9$$$. Other pairs of $$$A$$$ and $$$B$$$ don't satisfy the given constraints.
